text: The number one thing options aren't is a easy way to make X number of dollars per day per week or per month. It is bullshit. You are just seeing good marketing because they are praying on a psychological component. We want to believe that something is easy, able to make us good money without a lot of effort. The problem is it doesn't exist. We know it doesn't exist, but we make them mentally leave anyways because we want it to be true. This is disingenuous marketing. Options are great products. I mean, advocate for them. I've traded them for 16 years and they've made me wealthy. I like them. The problem is it's such bullshit to present them to people as these super simple things and the only thing it does is set people up for failure. Once you get over the learning curve, they are very simple to deploy. It doesn't make them easy. You gotta get over that learning curve first and accept the challenge. Be an dollar sale later.

ABOUT:
My name is Erik, I'm a Marine veteran and self-made millionaire investor. I've spent over 30,000+ hours honing my craft and outpaced the market for the last 15 years. My goal is to share quality information and connect others to resources - without the BS. 

The Outlier Community is built to connect you with other driven people who are pursuing or have achieved financial outlier status. We get together to capitalize on the hive mind to share ideas, explore stock market news, cover investing basics, options trading, portfolio management, investing psychology, strategy, money management, live trading ideas, workshops, and more. None of us find success solely on our own - here we create it together. Welcome to the Outliers!

I am not a financial advisor. All content is shared for educational and entertainment purposes only.
